intro: Chamaesyce fendleri, commonly known as desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs, helping to reduce water loss. Its flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters during the spring and summer months. Chamaesyce fendleri is well adapted to sandy soils and can tolerate extreme temperature fluctuations.
